intro: Impatiens ramenensis, commonly known as the Ramen impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Balsaminaceae family, characterized by its showy, brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and a distinctive spur at the base of the bloom.
